university.name: UMSKAL
university.full_name: Universiti Malaysia Sabah Kampus Antarabangsa Labuan
university.faculties: FKI (Fakulti Komputeran dan Informatik), FKAL (Fakulti Kewangan Antarabangsa Labuan)
university.description: UMSKAL is a public research university offering undergraduate and postgraduate programs in information technology, and finance.

feedback_system.purpose: Allow students to voice opinions and suggestions to help improve the university
feedback_system.how_to_submit: Click the 'Submit Feedback' button on the feedback system page and type out your comments and suggestions
feedback_system.response_time: Feedback is reviewed and responded to within working hours
feedback_system.confidentiality: Your feedback can be submitted anonymously if preferred

lecture_halls.description: Modern, well-equipped lecture halls with multimedia facilities

library.name: UMSKAL Main Library
library.description: Comprehensive library with physical and digital resources
library.hours: Monday-Friday: 8:00 AM - 10:00 PM, Saturday-Sunday: 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM

student_center.description: Hub for student activities and welfare

cafeteria.description: Multiple food outlets serving diverse cuisines

health_clinic.name: UMSKAL Health Clinic
health_clinic.description: Medical services for students and staff

organisations.description: Student leadership and welfare organizations representing student interests and providing support to the student community. These bodies facilitate student governance, welfare initiatives, and faculty-specific activities.
name: Majlis Perwakilan Pelajar (MPP)
Jawatankuasa Kebajikan Mahasiswa/i (JAKMAS)
Persatuan Mahasiswa FKAL (PMFKAL)
Persatuan Mahasiswa FKI (PMFKI)

sports_clubs.description: Clubs focused on sports and recreational activities including volleyball, netball, traditional games, fitness, and esports. These clubs promote physical wellness, teamwork, and competitive spirit among students.
name: Labuan International Campus Volleyball Club (LICVC)
Netball Club
Boule Club
Gymnasium Club
UMSLIC Esports Club

social_clubs.description: Clubs dedicated to social causes, community service, peer support, and personal development. These include volunteer work, mentorship programs, language learning, and fostering harmony among students.
name: Rotaract Club (RACUMSKAL)
Pembimbing Rakan Siswa (PRS)
Kelab Sukarelawan Siswa (Kesuwa-kal)
Kelab Bahasa Xclusive
Kelab Mahasiswa Harmoni
Leo Club

culture_club.description: Clubs celebrating cultural heritage, performing arts, and traditional practices. These clubs promote cultural appreciation, artistic expression, and traditional skills such as martial arts and music.
name: Kelab Kesenian & Kebudayaan
Kelab Silat
Kelab Muzikal
Kelab Sahabat Masjid Al-Hikmah
Catholic Student Group (CSGKAL)
religious_club.description: Faith-based clubs providing spiritual support and religious community for students of different beliefs. These clubs organize religious activities, discussions, and provide a welcoming community for members.

council_member.description: Stand a chance to contribute as a High Council or Executive Council (MTME) in any clubs to train leadership and communication skills.
requirements: No disciplinary action in student record
council_member.selection_process: Through interview and filtering by High Councils.

it_support.contact: IT Help Desk: helpdesk@umskal.my or +60 82-583450 Ext. 1600

student_welfare.description: Support for student wellbeing and development

admission.requirements: SPM/A-Level results or international equivalent, minimum CGPA/grades
admission.application_process: Apply online via UMSKAL website or MARA portal

attendance.requirement: Minimum 80% attendance required for each course
attendance.exceptions: Medical certificates and approved absences may be considered

academic_standing.dismissal: Repeated failure to meet minimum standards may result in academic dismissal

main_office.address: Universiti Malaysia Sabah Kampus Antarabangsa Labuan

important_offices.registrar: Registrar's Office - Academic records and enrollment
important_offices.student_affairs: Student Affairs Office - Student welfare and development
important_offices.finance: Finance Office (Level 3 Menara)- Fees, payments, and financial matters

frequently_asked_topics.how_to_submit_feedback: Use the feedback form on the feedback system page
frequently_asked_topics.who_reads_feedback: Student affairs office and relevant departments review feedback
frequently_asked_topics.what_happens_to_feedback: Feedback is analyzed and used to improve university services and facilities
frequently_asked_topics.can_feedback_be_anonymous: Yes, you can submit anonymous feedback
frequently_asked_topics.tuition_fees: Contact Finance Office for current fee structure
frequently_asked_topics.scholarship_information: Visit Student Affairs Office or check website for available scholarships
frequently_asked_topics.housing_on_campus: Limited on-campus housing available; apply through Student Affairs
frequently_asked_topics.internship_opportunities: Contact Career Development Center for internship placements
